preface.p: Pakistan federal tax legal corpus for the Momentum EZ compliance stack. Consolidates key provisions from the Income Tax Ordinance, 2001 (Ordinance XLIX of 2001) as amended through Finance Act 2024, the Sales Tax Act, 1990 (Act VII of 1990), and the Special Economic Zones Act, 2012. Rates and thresholds reflect fiscal year 2025-26.

content.p: Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, income tax shall be charged for each tax year, at the rates specified in the First Schedule, on every person who has taxable income for the year.
A person who has Pakistan-source income shall be liable to tax under this Ordinance whether or not that person is a resident.
Tax shall be computed on the taxable income of a person for a tax year, being the total income of the person for the year reduced by any deductible allowances under Part IX of Chapter III.
The rate of income tax imposed on the taxable income of a company for tax year 2025 shall be 29%.

For small companies as defined under section 2(59A), the rate of income tax for tax year 2025 shall be 20%, provided the company is listed on the Active Taxpayers List maintained by the Federal Board of Revenue and its turnover does not exceed PKR 250,000,000.
Banking companies shall be taxed at the rate of 39% on their taxable income for tax year 2025.

section.heading: Super Tax for Rehabilitation of Temporarily Displaced Persons

content.p: In addition to the tax imposed under other provisions of this Ordinance, a super tax shall be imposed at the following rates:

item.p: Banking companies: 10% on income exceeding PKR 500,000,000.

Other companies (including textile, sugar, oil and gas, fertilizer, LNG terminal, iron and steel, airlines, automobile, cement, chemicals, beverages, and tobacco): 10% on income exceeding PKR 500,000,000.
All other persons: 4% on income exceeding PKR 150,000,000.

content.p: Where the tax payable by a taxpayer (other than an individual or AOP having turnover of less than PKR 100,000,000) under any other provision of this Ordinance for a tax year is less than 1.25% of the person's gross turnover for that year, the person shall pay tax at the rate of 1.25% of the gross turnover.
For purposes of this section, "turnover" means the gross receipts, exclusive of sales tax and federal excise duty, derived from the sale of goods, rendering of services, or execution of contracts.
Minimum tax paid under this section may be carried forward for adjustment against tax liability for five succeeding tax years.

Every person responsible for collecting customs duty on goods imported into Pakistan shall also collect advance tax from the importer at the following rates on the value of goods as determined under Section 25 of the Customs Act, 1969, plus customs duty and sales tax:

item.p: Industrial undertakings importing raw materials: 1% for persons on the Active Taxpayers List (ATL).
Commercial importers on ATL: 2%.
Persons not appearing on ATL: 6% (double the applicable rate, with a minimum of 6%).

content.p: Tax collected under this section is an advance tax adjustable against the final tax liability of the importer for the relevant tax year.

Every employer paying salary to an employee shall deduct tax at the time of payment at the employee's average rate of tax for the tax year, computed as the tax on estimated taxable income for the year divided by estimated taxable income, applied to each payment of salary.
The graduated slab rates for salaried individuals (tax year 2025, per the First Schedule Division I) are:

item.p: Taxable income up to PKR 600,000: 0%.
Taxable income from PKR 600,001 to PKR 1,200,000: 5% of the amount exceeding PKR 600,000.
Taxable income from PKR 1,200,001 to PKR 2,200,000: PKR 30,000 plus 15% of the amount exceeding PKR 1,200,000.
Taxable income from PKR 2,200,001 to PKR 3,200,000: PKR 180,000 plus 25% of the amount exceeding PKR 2,200,000.
Taxable income from PKR 3,200,001 to PKR 4,100,000: PKR 430,000 plus 30% of the amount exceeding PKR 3,200,000.
Taxable income exceeding PKR 4,100,000: PKR 700,000 plus 35% of the amount exceeding PKR 4,100,000.

section.heading: Withholding Tax on Profit on Debt

content.p: Every person paying profit on debt (including profit on any security of the Federal Government, a Provincial Government, or a local authority, yield on an account or deposit with a banking company, finance company, or institution) shall deduct tax at the following rates:
Tax deducted under this section on profit on debt paid on a deposit maintained with a banking company or financial institution shall be final tax on that income.

section.heading: Withholding Tax on Payments for Services, Goods, and Contracts

content.p: Every prescribed person making a payment to a resident for rendering of or providing of services, supply of goods, or execution of a contract shall deduct tax at source at the following rates:

item.p: Transport services: 2% (ATL); 4% (non-ATL).
Services rendered by companies: 8% (ATL); 16% (non-ATL).
Supply of goods by companies: 4.5% (ATL); 9% (non-ATL).
Execution of contracts by companies: 7% (ATL); 14% (non-ATL).
Execution of contracts by other persons: 7.5% (ATL); 15% (non-ATL).

content.p: For the purposes of this section, "prescribed person" includes the Federal Government, a Provincial Government, a local authority, a company, an AOP with annual turnover exceeding PKR 100,000,000, and an individual with annual turnover exceeding PKR 50,000,000.
Every authorized dealer in foreign exchange shall deduct advance tax at the rate of 1% from the proceeds of export realized by an exporter at the time the proceeds are realized.
Tax deducted under this section shall be a final tax on the income of the exporter arising from the export of goods.

section.heading: Withholding Tax on Income from Property

content.p: Every prescribed person paying rent of immovable property shall deduct advance tax at the following rates:

item.p: Annual rent up to PKR 200,000: Nil.
Annual rent from PKR 200,001 to PKR 600,000: 5% of the gross amount of rent for persons on ATL; double for non-ATL.
Annual rent from PKR 600,001 to PKR 2,000,000: 10% of the gross amount of rent for ATL persons; double for non-ATL.

section.heading: Advance Tax on Cash Withdrawal from a Bank

content.p: Every banking company shall deduct advance tax at the following rates on cash withdrawals or cash transfers through any mode (over-the-counter, online, cheque, clearing) exceeding PKR 50,000 in a day from an account:

item.p: Persons appearing on ATL: 0.6% of the amount withdrawn.
Persons not appearing on ATL: 1.2% of the amount withdrawn.

content.p: This section does not apply to withdrawals by the Federal Government, Provincial Governments, foreign diplomats, or persons specifically exempt under the Second Schedule.

section.heading: Advance Tax on Sales to Distributors, Dealers, and Wholesalers

content.p: Every manufacturer or commercial importer shall collect advance tax at the rate of 0.1% of the gross amount of sales from any person to whom a sale of goods is made where such person is a distributor, dealer, or wholesaler.
Where the purchaser does not appear on the Active Taxpayers List, the rate shall be 0.2% (double the standard rate).
Tax collected under this section is an advance tax adjustable against the final tax liability of the purchaser for the relevant tax year.

part.heading: Special Economic Zones Act, 2012 (Act XXI of 2012) -- Tax Provisions

section.heading: Income Tax Exemption for Zone Enterprises

content.p: A zone enterprise that has been granted admission by the zone authority shall be exempt from income tax for a period of ten years commencing from the date of commencement of commercial operations, as certified by the zone authority and notified to the Federal Board of Revenue.
This exemption shall not apply to income derived from sources outside the special economic zone or to income from activities not approved under the enterprise's admission letter.

section.heading: One-Time Customs Duty Exemption on Capital Goods

content.p: A zone enterprise shall be entitled to a one-time exemption from customs duties on the import of capital goods, including plant, machinery, equipment, and apparatus, required for the establishment of the enterprise within the special economic zone.

This exemption shall be subject to the enterprise obtaining prior approval from the zone authority and the goods being installed and used exclusively within the zone for a period of not less than five years from the date of import.

section.heading: Zero-Rated Sales Tax for Zone Exports

content.p: Goods manufactured or produced within a special economic zone by a zone enterprise and exported outside Pakistan shall be subject to sales tax at the rate of zero percent.
Input tax credit on raw materials and components consumed in the manufacture of zero-rated goods shall be refundable in accordance with the provisions of the Sales Tax Act, 1990.

section.heading: Scope and Rate of Sales Tax

content.p: Subject to the provisions of this Act, there shall be charged, levied, and collected a tax known as sales tax at the rate of 18% of the value of taxable supplies made by a registered person in the course or furtherance of any taxable activity carried on by that person.

The standard rate of 18% applies to fiscal year 2025-26 unless otherwise specified in the relevant schedule. Reduced rates apply to specific categories of goods as listed in the Eighth Schedule to this Act.

Sales tax on the import of goods into Pakistan shall be collected at the time of importation at the same rate as applies to taxable supplies of like goods in Pakistan, and shall be charged on the value of the goods as determined under Section 25 of the Customs Act, 1969, plus customs duty and federal excise duty.
A supply of goods shall be a taxable supply if it is a supply of goods in Pakistan other than a supply of goods that is exempt under Section 13 or the Sixth Schedule.
A supply of goods shall be zero-rated if the goods are exported, or if the supply is listed in the Fifth Schedule to this Act.

For the purposes of this Act, the time of supply is the earlier of: the date an invoice is issued; or the date on which payment is received; or the date on which the goods are delivered or made available to the recipient.
The following supplies shall be zero-rated:

item.p: Goods exported from Pakistan or shipped as stores for consumption on board a conveyance proceeding to a destination outside Pakistan.
Such other goods as the Federal Government may by notification in the official Gazette specify, subject to conditions and procedures as it may prescribe.
Supplies to diplomats, diplomatic missions, and privileged persons and organizations as listed in the Fifth Schedule, subject to the conditions and procedures prescribed therein.

content.p: A registered person making zero-rated supplies is entitled to claim a refund of input tax paid on goods or services used in making such supplies, in accordance with the procedures prescribed under Section 10.
